definitions.definition: To try to get a ride in a passing vehicle while standing at the side of a road , generally by either sticking out one's finger or thumb or holding a sign with one's stated destination .
examples: After much deliberation, he decided hitchhiking was his only way out of London.

definitions.definition: To try to get (a ride ) in a passing vehicle while standing at the side of a road , generally by either sticking out one's finger or thumb or holding a sign with one's stated destination .
examples: Pamela hitchhiked a ride to New York.

definitions.definition: To be carried along with something else.
examples: In genetic hitchhiking , a gene is propagated because it occurs in conjunction with a favourable mutation.
In cultural hitchhiking , a cultural trait spreads with a technologically advanced population.

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To try to get a ride in a passing vehicle while standing at the side of a road , generally by either sticking out one's finger or thumb or holding a sign with one's stated destination .
secondary_definitions: ( US , transitive ) To try to get (a ride ) in a passing vehicle while standing at the side of a road , generally by either sticking out one's finger or thumb or holding a sign with one's stated destination .
( US , transitive ) to make (one's way) by hitchhiking .
( intransitive , by extension ) To be carried along with something else.
